Description: Small complete scarab, made of beige steatite. Some details carved, no glaze preserved? Division between prothorax and elytra as well as suture shown by an incised line. A small line runs partly around the perforation at the lower end of the elytra. The humeral callosities are shown by triangles. The head is visible, but no eyes. The clypeus is shown but without details, the plates are visible as well The side shows two legs on each side in relief, on top of a base line. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base. On the left a seated mAa.t figure with a feather on the head and long hairs at the neck? In front a wAs underneath of a small oval unidentified sign, t? Underneath mAa.t and wAs a nb-basket.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
